source.9ee0ad5a:
Once again we can see that countries like South Korea have more cases tested than confirmed. 

That means that their rate of testing has been greater than their rate of new case infections. Thus after a point they have more people tested than they have confirmed cases as shown in the figure above (blue bar is higher than the orange bar). Such countries like South Korea have been more successful at dealing with this pandemic.

While other countries have a lower rate of testing than rate of infection (blue bar is shorter than the orange bar). Therefore for these countries the number of tested is lesser than the number of confirmed cases. Many such countries have had difficulties dealing with the pandemic.
